etymologies: late Middle English (denoting the time during which something, especially a disease, runs its course): from Old French periode, via Latin from Greek periodos ‘orbit, recurrence, course’, from peri- ‘around’ + hodos ‘way, course’. The sense ‘portion of time’ dates from the early 17th century

definitions: a length or portion of time

examples.text: he had long periods of depression
the training period is between 16 and 18 months
the ale will be available for a limited period

definitions: a portion of time in the life of a nation, civilization, etc. characterized by the same prevalent features or conditions
shortDefinitions: portion of time in life of nation etc.

definitions: a major division of geological time that is a subdivision of an era and is itself subdivided into epochs, corresponding to a system in chronostratigraphy
one of the set divisions of the day in a school allocated to a lesson or other activity

examples.text: two periods of PE are allocated on the timetable
he interviewed the teachers when they had a free period

definitions: each of the intervals into which the playing time of a sporting event is divided

examples.text: the Lightnings ran at the Leafs hard in a very rough first period

definitions: the interval of time between successive occurrences of the same state in an oscillatory or cyclic phenomenon, such as a mechanical vibration, an alternating current, a variable star, or an electromagnetic wave.
shortDefinitions: interval between successive occurrences of same state

definitions: the time taken by a celestial object to rotate around its axis, or to make one circuit of its orbit.
shortDefinitions: time taken by celestial object to rotate or orbit

definitions: the interval between successive equal values of a periodic function.
shortDefinitions: interval between equal values of periodic function

definitions: a flow of blood and other material from the lining of the uterus, occurring in nonpregnant women at intervals of about 28 days between puberty and menopause and typically lasting for a few days
shortDefinitions: monthly flow of blood etc. from uterus

definitions: a punctuation mark (.) used at the end of a sentence or an abbreviation.
added to the end of a statement to indicate that no further discussion is possible or desirable

examples.text: he is the sole owner of the trademark, period

shortDefinitions: indicating no further discussion is possible or desirable

synonyms.text: and that is the end of the matter

definitions: a set of elements occupying an entire horizontal row in the periodic table.
shortDefinitions: set of elements occupying horizontal row in periodic table

definitions: a complex sentence, especially one consisting of several clauses, constructed as part of a formal speech or oration.
a complete idea, typically consisting of two or four phrases.
belonging to or characteristic of a past historical time, especially in style or design

examples.text: a splendid selection of period furniture
